text: Massive Python set of integers using too much memory
I have a set of unique integers with values between 1 and 50 million.
New integers are added at random e.g.
I need to be able to quickly add new integers and quickly check if an integer is already present.
After a while, the set grows too large for my low memory system and I experience MemoryErrors.
How can I achieve this while using less memory?
What's the fastest way to do this using the disk without reconfiguring the system e.g.
Should I use a database file like sqlite?
Is there a library that will compress the integers in memory?
